Admin.title: Admin
Admin.description: Represents an administrator user. The document ID is the user's UID.

uid.description: The Firebase Authentication User ID of the admin.

addedAt.description: ISO timestamp of when admin privileges were granted.

Account.title: Account
Account.description: Represents a user's account, linking Firebase Auth UID to their VSD balance and wallet.

photoURL.description: URL of the user's profile picture.

vsdLiteBalance.description: The user's VSD Lite token balance (off-chain reward points).

status.description: The status of the account (e.g., Active, Suspended).

joined.description: ISO timestamp of when the user joined.

roles.description: A list of roles assigned to the user (e.g., 'admin', 'advertiser').

Tenant.title: Tenant
Tenant.description: Represents an integrated partner project or website in the VSD ecosystem.

apiKey.description: The generated API key for the tenant.

createdAt.description: ISO timestamp of when the tenant was created.

Transaction.title: Transaction
Transaction.description: Represents a single ledger activity within the VSD Network.

user.description: Display name of the user involved.

accountId.description: The ID of the account involved in the transaction.

from.description: The sender's wallet address or identifier.

to.description: The recipient's wallet address or identifier.

description.description: A brief description of the transaction.

Advertisement.title: Advertisement
Advertisement.description: Represents an advertiser's video or link for user engagement rewards.

advertiserId.description: The UID of the user account that owns this ad.

url.description: The URL for the video source or the click-through link.

reward.description: The amount of VSD Lite tokens rewarded for interaction.

clicks.description: The total number of clicks or completed views.

createdAt.description: ISO timestamp of when the ad was created.

status.description: The status of the advertisement campaign.

AdvertiserApplication.title: Advertiser Application
AdvertiserApplication.description: Represents an application submitted by a user to become an advertiser.

companyName.description: The name of the advertiser's company.

businessDescription.description: A description of the business and advertising goals.

submittedAt.description: ISO timestamp of when the application was submitted.

ApiLog.title: API Access Log
ApiLog.description: Records an incoming request to a VSD Network API endpoint.

status.description: Whether the API key was validated successfully.

tenantId.description: The ID of the tenant that made the request (if key was valid).

endpoint.description: The API endpoint that was accessed.

message.description: A summary of the request or error.

Leaderboard.title: Leaderboard
Leaderboard.description: A pre-computed list of top accounts for a specific metric.

updatedAt.description: ISO timestamp of when the leaderboard was last updated.

topHolders.description: An array of the top account holders.

/admins/{adminId}.description: Stores a list of admin UIDs for role-based access control.

/accounts/{accountId}.description: Stores individual user account data, keyed by Firebase Auth UID.

/accounts/{accountId}/transactions/{tran.description: A subcollection storing all transactions for a specific user account.

/tenants/{tenantId}.description: Top-level collection for all partner tenants integrated with the VSD Network.

/transactions/{transactionId}.description: A global log of all transactions for administrative overview. Can be secured for admin-only access.

/advertisements/{advertisementId}.description: Stores all advertisement campaigns that users can interact with to earn VSD Lite.

/advertiserApplications/{applicationId}.description: Stores applications from users wishing to become advertisers.

/api_logs/{logId}.description: Stores a log of all incoming requests to protected VSD Network API endpoints for monitoring and debugging.

/leaderboards/topHolders.description: A single document containing a pre-computed list of the top VSD token holders. This is designed for public read access.
